org.magelan.core.variant
Interface Variant

All Superinterfaces:
CoreModel, DrawingModel
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultVariant
public interface Variant
extends CoreModel

A drawing variant. Provides means to create a variant solution on top of an existing CoreModel. Variants have a separate set of entities, which can be compared, merged and updated against the entities of the parent drawing. Variants support their own current color, line style and thickness, viewport and derivates. The set of layers of a variant is also independent.

Though this interface does not extend the Derivate interface, it makes sence for a class to implement both interfaces and commit and update the Variant against the parent CoreModel obtained using the Derivate.getParent() method.

Version:
1.1, 05/2004
Author:
Assen Antov

KEY_COLOR_NEW

static final java.lang.String KEY_COLOR_NEW
A Variant property, containing the color to use for painting of new entities. If null or not set the default color for the entity will be used.

getDiffs

java.util.List getDiffs(CoreModel parent)
Returns a list of differences between the variant and the parent CoreModel. The returned entities can be new, modified or deleted. Therefore the list may contain entities from both drawings.

Parameters:
parent - parent CoreModel to get diffs from
Returns:
a list of differences
See Also:
Variant.Diff

getLastDiffs

java.util.List getLastDiffs()
Returns a copy of the last list of differences returned by getDiffs(CoreModel).

Returns:
the last list of differences
